abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Private Sector
            Development Credit Project in Mauritania are as follows:
            overall outcome of the project was rated satisfactory, and
            the performance of the Bank and the Borrower were also as
            satisfactory. Some of the lessons learned from the project
            are: 1) devote adequate time and effort to build
            understanding and ownership of reforms at both the political
            and the administrative levels, and effectively involve the
            Borrower in supervising the reform program; 2) carefully
            assess the sequencing and timing of the reform program and
            explicitly link the corresponding institutional support to
            the implementation timetable of the reform program; 3)
            maintain continuity within the Bank team throughout
            preparation, appraisal end supervision, and carefully build
            and maintain relations with counterpart staff, working with
            them as a team; and 4) ensure there is good coordination
            with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and donors, right
            from the beginning.
